text: Hey everyone, quick query
So I'm using isotype to filter my posts, is it possible to split a tab so I can show the most popular posts
<https://gyazo.com/a055f794941098beb069ea7c1efe7b1f>
I'm trying to show the most popular posts here and the rest of the tabs to show there relevant articles
I was thinking of an `if` statement targeting the `all` data-filter but not sure if that would be the best route
<https://i.gyazo.com/a7f55efeeb078d7a909f68621f62e7ee.png>
Or even if that's possible

No, I know that you can change the date format, I was talking about the format of the format. For example, the publish dates have formats like "EEEE, MMMM d, yyyy". The same format for the filter would be "%A, %b %e, %Y".
I'm looking to format an arbitrary date by the format set in the settings.
the data filter if statement wont work
Yeah I was just trying it out
how are you trying tio use this
if all it shows the popular?
are you using isotope?
or page refreshes?
I'm just doing what the client has told me to do haha show the most popular posts on the `all` tab
sorry didt seer the past post
I can paste in the JS if that helps?
But it's pretty standard
Only add the `all` class to the popular posts
that sounds like some classic client logic
I know :joy:
then you will only get pop posts on all
there is a query for most popular
are you using data category for sorting?
if so `all` would go there
Yes
keep ion mind.. the most popular is only going to show most popular. all of those posts will be available in the categories as well so they dont need the cat slug
so replace `{{ topic.slug}}` with `all`
should be able to get rid of the if statement as well.
also remove all from the standard posts below
In the data-category for popular posts or the normal articles as well?
only the popular posts
all should be removed from the other posts below
OK this is what I have now <@U38EZFVFE>
In the other tags it's still showing the most popular (the blue ones) when it shouldn't <https://gyazo.com/7bb1fb67529d4bcbb16cf6ee300bb686>
looks good
The blue ones are popular?
Yep
you need to figure out what all does
is it even in your js?
Is what in my JS
the all class
how does isotope figure out what posts to show?
For the JS I have this
Hope that helps <@U38EZFVFE>
`data-filter="*"` should be `data-filter="all"`
in your hubl
Still showing
can you send me a link?
Might be due to the article tags that there getting picked up
It's only on preview at the moment, not live
try removing that from them like so:
`<article class="post" data-category="all">`

I have a couple of blog questions I'm hoping someone can help me with :slightly_smiling_face:

1. How do blogs that load the next piece of content do it (switching URLs and all) - check out the way <https://blog.withings.com/> loads a new post at the bottom - e.g. <https://blog.withings.com/2019/03/21/infographic-the-great-american-sleep-study/> - seemingly forever

2. Would it be possible to do something like that on HubSpot? I feel like a HuBL solution here would be inefficient as it would have to load everything upfront, from the first question, is there a way to redirect to the new page easily?
On the most popular listing <@U38EZFVFE>
yep
most popular should only show when all is selected
lets finish this here
OK one sec
OK that kind of worked
It's hiding all of the `all` articles on different tabs
But it's also now hiding a lot of articles relevant to that tab
<https://gyazo.com/add3c517cd5d346f48e36173406e516d>
<https://gyazo.com/c8bc33db00cbe5d733caf2945e214f43>
See all the white space on inbound there all hidden articles
Strange right :confused: <@U38EZFVFE>
So it's hiding all, but not removing them from the div
So it seems I need to remove all articles with `data-category="all"` if I'm not on that tab
yep
Looks like you are well on your way now .
OK one last thing <@U38EZFVFE>
How would I go about hiding the `data-category` all articles
Nevermind isotype was adding some inline styling
OK display: none is getting set on the most popular posts when I click back onto the `all` tab
But the overwrite doesn't take affect
I've also tried `.show()`
<http://flyingsaucer-4856132.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-9e615f67-20d2-45cd-912d-1cb79dec8a37?hs_preview=bBXyckvp-9499920171>
So everything is working as expected, and the correct posts are being hidden on the other tabs
But see how if you click onto another tab then back onto the `all` tab the posts aren't shown because `display: none` is being set inline
<@U38EZFVFE>

Anyone know how to get multiple query strings that share the same field to return both values? e.g. when I use `{{ request.query_dict.field }}` with the following query `<http://example.com/?field=value_1&field=value_2|example.com/?field=value_1&field=value_2>` I only get the first value to return...
nvm, i think i'll just use {{ request.query }} and parse the string myself
do hubl for loops not work in css files?

There is already an option for this in the system options:
